summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganCeraVe Hydrating Foaming Oil Cleanser is a water-based face wash for dry skin with hyaluronic acid, ceramides, squalane and triglycerides, that cleanses without stripping moisture.
details: DetailsBenefitsDaily wash with hyaluronic acid, ceramides, squalane and triglycerides cleanses without stripping moistureRemoves face makeup, dirt, and excess oil, provides lasting hydration and leaves soothed and comfortable, non-greasy feelTransforms from an oil into a soft lathering foam to cleanse, to help hydrate, and leave skin feeling comforted/comfortable without a tight, dry skin feelingFragrance-free and non-comedogenic. Suitable for dry to very dry skin. Suitable for sensitive skin, atopic-prone skin and baby skinAccepted by the National Eczema Association (NEA)Effectively removes makeup without disrupting the natural skin barrierDeveloped with dermatologists, CeraVe is the #1 Dermatologist Recommended Skin Care BrandKey IngredientsCeramides help restore your skin's natural barrier, helping to keep moisture in and harmful elements outHyaluronic Acid is essential for maintaining skin's moisture balance and helps give skin a smooth, plump textureSqualane Oil is known to help retain skinâ€™s moistureFormulated WithoutFragranceItem 2611324How To UseWet skin with warm water. Dispense a pea-sized amount of product from the bottle via the pump applicator. Gently massage the product onto wet skin, and watch as the oil transforms into a lightweight foam . Rinse well with water and pat dry with a clean towel. Avoid contact with eyes. If contact occurs rinse thoroughly with water.IngredientsAqua / Water / Eau, Glycerin, Peg-200 Hydrogenated Glyceryl Palmate, Coco-Betaine, Disodium Cocoyl Glutamate, Peg-120 Methyl Glucose Dioleate, Polysorbate 20, Peg-7 Glyceryl Cocoate, Squalane, Ceramide Np, Ceramide Ap, Ceramide Eop, Carbomer, Triethyl Citrate, Sodium Chloride, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate, Sodium Benzoate, Sodium Lauroyl Lactylate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Cholesterol, Citric Acid, Capryloyl Glycine, Hydroxyacetophenone, Caprylyl Glycol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Phytosphingosine, Xanthan Gum, Benzoic Acid, Peg-150 Pentaerythrityl Tetrastearate, Ppg-5-Ceteth-20, Peg-6 Caprylic/Capric Glycerides.
how_to_use: Wet skin with warm water. Dispense a pea-sized amount of product from the bottle via the pump applicator. Gently massage the product onto wet skin, and watch as the oil transforms into a lightweight foam . Rinse well with water and pat dry with a clean towel. Avoid contact with eyes. If contact occurs rinse thoroughly with water.

reviews.headline: I would re buy this forever
reviews.comments: This took off my makeup without anything else and  made my skin super soft over time, definitely worth your money

reviews.headline: Not an Oil Cleanser, drying
reviews.comments: This is more of a traditional soapy cleanser than an oil cleanser. I am 36 and have normal-dry skin, it leaves my skin feeling tight and uncomfortable after washing and I feel that I need to scrub a bit more than I'd like to get my skin clean. Works great for brushes., may be good for oilier skin.

reviews.headline: Not an oil cleanser
reviews.comments:
I have been trying to replace my beloved, discontinued Eucerin Skin Calming Body Wash (a soybean oil based oil cleanser), and this is one of the many products I have tried. This is not an oil cleanser. It does not have an oily consistency, but something like a thin gel consistency. Skinfix has something similar (although a lot more expensive). So does Naturium. 
This cleanser is VERY stripping and drying and dehydrating if you are used to a true oil cleanser. 
So disappointed in Cerave (and so many other brands) for calling a stripping gel cleanser an oil cleanser.
I will say, this isn't a bad product if you are looking for a normal gel cleanser. For someone with sensitive, easily stripped, dehydrated skin, this is highly disappointing and not what was advertised.

reviews.headline: Not what I was expecting
reviews.comments: This is a strange product. It says "foaming oil cleanser" and "water based face wash." I was thinking it would be more of a liquid cleansing balm/oil. It isn't. So I thought id share/

reviews.headline: this is soap
reviews.comments: I'm a regular user of oil cleansers; they've improved my skin so much since turning 40. Looking for a more economical option, I tried this, but was disappointed. "Foaming" should have tipped me off that there is a surfactant (soap) in this, but I didn't make the connection right away. My skin wasn't a disaster after using this, but it was dryer and tighter than I like and didn't feel very clean; my skin looked dull and kind of filmy as well. I'll be returning it.

reviews.headline: Great product for my combo skin!
reviews.comments: I personally really like this cleanser, and it seems to work really well on my acne prone oily/combo skin. Some people in other reviews have complained it's not a true oil cleanser. While I do agree that it's more water based and not a full on oil, it is much more gentle on the skin than other foaming face washes because it does have some oil in it. It's almost like an oily soap? I like this because I think an actual oil cleanser would break me out. My face gets so dry in the winter to the point I am unable to use my acne wash (Panoxyl and La Roshe) as often, so I started using this and it's helped with my dryness so much and didn't cause me to breakout more. I break out very very easily too. If you have combo skin this is perfect for maintaining hydration on dry spots and getting rid of excess oil on oiler spots.

reviews.headline: You get what you pay for!
reviews.comments: My parents used to say, "You get what you pay for". This was sticky, gooey, not refreshing at all and made my skin feel dry and unclean. With everything going up, up and up i thought I'd try something less costly but even this was too much money for what I feel was lower quality.  We deserve better people!

reviews.headline: Very good product for aging skin
reviews.comments: I am on my third bottle of this. I like to use this to wash my makeup off at night. It never leaves my skin dry and flaky and it gets the job done.  It lathers nicely and makes my face feel smooth and clean afterwards.

reviews.headline: Too drying for me
reviews.comments: I ran out of my usual facial cleanser (Vanicream) and decided to try this one out. Unfortunately, it didn't work for me. The liquid is very thin and did not foam well, so I felt like I needed to use more to cover my face. Immediately after rinsing, my face felt tight. It didn't not feel hydrating at all to me. I gave it an extra star because the scent is inoffensive and it seemed to clean well, but I won't repurchase. Back to my trusty Vanicream.

reviews.headline: Very good product for dry skin
reviews.comments: Good product

reviews.headline: I've repurchased this at least 4 times
reviews.comments: This is really the only face wash that's helped my skin but I will say if your buying this because it says oil cleanser it's actually water based.This is my favorite cleanser as someone whos skin breaks out if I put anything new on it.

reviews.headline: Soothing wash
reviews.comments: Does not get foamy. But does help sooth dry sensitive skin

reviews.headline: Not really an oil cleanser
reviews.comments: This cleanser isnt really a oil to foam formula. Its just soap. It doesnt remove makeup well and it leaves waterproof mascara even after rinsing. Its not hydrating and honestly doesnt feel like an oil. It just feels like a not great facial cleanser like an old school clean and clear bar soap.

reviews.headline: Broke me out immediately.
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this product SO bad since I am on the dryer side, but unfortunately it did not mix well with my acne prone skin. Literally within hours of using the wash, I started breaking out on my forehead which is where I detect if a product will be a thumbs up or down for me. The wash did feel very gentle on the skin when applying though. My skin did not feel stripped either.

reviews.headline: I will buy again
reviews.comments: This is a product I will be using ..on going..please provide me a sale price next time

reviews.headline: Good
reviews.comments: Good

reviews.headline: Very nice!
reviews.comments: I bought this thinking that it was going to be an actual oil cleanser like the one you use whithout water but it wasn't. I still really like it it's a nice product.

reviews.headline: Too Drying & Irritating
reviews.comments:
This caused redness and really irritated my skin.
I did not find this to be a true oil cleanser; it feels and acts like a regular gel type cleanser.
I like CeraVe but this was not what I expected; my more mature, sensitive skin did not respond well.

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: Perfect for removing water prof makeup

reviews.headline: Only product I use
reviews.comments: Best product you will love it

faceoff_positive.comments: I am so satisfied with Cerave's Foaming Oil Cleanser.  It is easy to use and quite unique as you need to wet your face to activate the oil.  I first used it to wash the makeup off my face and I have to say, it did a good job dissolving and removing it.  As I usually do a double wash, I wet my face again, applied another pea sized amount of cleanser and immediately noticed that my face did not feel in any way stretched or tight, even though I washed it twice.  My skin actually remained supple and soft.  After using it just a few nights and mornings, I am in awe at how gently and effectively it cleans my skin without drying it out and how healthy looking it looks after.  I have used this at the sink and also taken it into the shower with me as it does need water to use it properly.  It is quite a nice product and one I will definitely use the whole bottle and rebuy!  I appreciate that this cleanser is residue free keeping all those harmful ingredients that damage my skin away and uses ingredients that will be a benefit to healthy skin.  My sister who has acne prone skin was also very impressed with how calming and gentle this was on her skin and how healthy her skin looks after using it.  It did not cause either of us redness or inflammation...this really is a good product and developed with Dermatologists!
faceoff_positive.headline: Supple, soft and Healthy looking!!

faceoff_negative.comments: I love Cerave as a brand and I was excited to try out a new oil cleanser. Fragrance-Free is always what I look for in skin care. I do a two-step cleansing process and use oil cleansers as the first step. This cleanser is good at getting off all of my makeup and sunscreen. The downside for me is that it is too stripping and it really dried out my skin. My skin is so sensitive and dry. It did mostly pass the sensitive skin test. I didn't have any redness or irritation, other than it did sting when I got it into my eye. I have other oil cleansers that I use that don't sting at all and I would prefer to be able to use my oil cleanser on my eyes. Unfortunately, it was just too intense for my skin and I had to tap out after 5 days. I will keep it as a backup for my regular products but I won't be able to use it every day. If you have regular or oily skin, I would definitely try it out.
faceoff_negative.headline: Good Product, Not For Me
